Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2011 12:02AM SueI12345 wrote: The surgeon said that after the procedure I would be there for a short while then I could go home.  So he is not doing general anasthetic but what does sound like 'twilight' anasthetic.
Posts.Title: Biopsy on Tuesday! SueI12345 crystalphm

Posts.Content: SueI12345 wrote: I have just come back from a surgeon - went for a second opinion on the dimpling on my breast.  He picked up that there is a nodule under my L breast - movable and squishy - said that was okay and he picked up a thickened area on my R breast. I had a mammo and US 3 weeks ago and neither was detected.  How can this be?  Anyways the surgeon says that he is not too worried about the dimpling, however, since it has to be caused by something has requested that I go for a MRI.  He is positive it is not B9 but doesnt want to take the chance just in case. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Second Opinion SueI12345 SarahsMom

Posts.Content: SueI12345 wrote: Went to a new Dr - one look at the dimple on my breast and has ordered a biopsy on Tuesday.  He couldnt feel any thickening or lumps.  He wants to do an open excisional biopsy... so I have opted for general anasthetic, dont think I could bear being aware of him working on my breast!  How long does it usually take for results?  The waiting will be the worst.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy on Tuesday! SueI12345 crystalphm

Posts.Content: SueI12345 wrote: After the wait which felt like forever... got my results and I am okay! The report has all sorts of medical terminology on but the end result is "there is a larger high signal area within the left breast just medial to the midline but no enhancement here to suggest a suspicious abnormality.  This is attributed to a sclerotic fibroadenoma." I have a follow up check up in 2 months time just as a precaution. Such a relief! To everyone, thank you for your thoughts and kind words.  You will be in my thoughts and prayers. [[[hugs]]] Sue Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Results are in!! SueI12345 Lisa1962

Posts.Content: SueI12345 wrote: Had my MRI done today, wasnt as bad an experience as I imagined it would be.  Worst part was when they put in the drip. I asked the Radiographer if she had seen anything on my scans, but she refused to tell me - I was hoping she would give me a hint.....! I have an appt with the surgeon at 11h45 on Thursday to discuss the results. Was very tearful this morning before the MRI but feel much better now.  Its hard to cope with things on your own, and I am grateful for my daughter who has been my shoulder to lean on but I really dont want to burden her with too much. Thanks for listening! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI done today SueI12345 Betterwannabe

Posts.Content: SueI12345 wrote: I am a 48yr old mother of 2 - discovered an indentation on my Left lower breast.  I notice this particularly when I raise my arm above my head or if I lean forward.  I have not managed to find any lumps and there is no discouration of skin or change in my nipple. There is no breast cancer in my family, but my dad did die of a very aggressive lung cancer. I went for my last mamogram in March 2009 and all was clear, and I have booked myself in for another one at 08h00 Monday 10th.  My mind is doing flip-flops worrying about what this could possibly mean.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Indentation on Breast SueI12345 aldumont01

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 09:27AM SueI12345 wrote: Just been advised that the Dr re-checked my last ultra sound scan vs the latest ultra sound scan and couldnt see anything wrong.  Still no explanation as to why the dimpling.   I have an appointment with my gynae tomorrow afternoon to discuss these scans - I am not happy that the dimpling is being considered as 'one of those things that happen' - I would like an answer, the dimpling is a result of something, and it is not in the areas where the dr found the cysts.
Posts.Title: Indentation on Breast SueI12345 aldumont01

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2011 02:02PM SueI12345 wrote: Have just come back from the gynae - after examination the gynae said that it appears the dimpling is from fatty tissue in the breast - something like cellulite.  However, the gynae has asked me to watch closely for any changes and to let her know immediately. The gynae felt positive that there was nothing to be concerned about.  I am not sure how I feel about this at the moment - I am trying to google anything similar on the internet and not having much luck sofar,
Posts.Title: Indentation on Breast SueI12345 aldumont01

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2011 01:08AM SueI12345 wrote: Thank you all for your kind thoughts, you make me wanna cry!! Will let you know as soon as I am back from the surgeon tomorrow. Lots of hugs
Posts.Title: MRI done today SueI12345 Betterwannabe

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2011 07:14AM SueI12345 wrote: Well the Dr found lots of cysts in my L breast, and 2 in my right breast.  At the moment they appear to be small.  I have to have another scan done in 6 months.   What are the chances the one of these cysts could be malignant?  The Dr said that he wasnt worried about them at all.  He also said that I have very dense breast tissue. Thanks for all your kind thoughts!
Posts.Title: Indentation on Breast SueI12345 aldumont01

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 06:24AM SueI12345 wrote: Hi Debbie, I found andimple/ indent on the L breast - went to have a mammo - nothing found because my breasts are so dense, then had an US - picked up a couple of cysts - but I felt the dr was in too much of a hurry and didnt seem concerned about the dimple/indent. All results from US were within normal parameters. Contacted our local Cansa branch who referred me to a breast clinic and I contacted them.  They were wonderful and one of the Oncologists phoned me back and advised I find a surgeon and go for a second opinion.  Well the surgeon I went to was very good, he wasnt too worried about the dimple/indent but then he checked my breasts and found a lump near to the dimple/indent and also a thickening in my other breast.  Neither were picked up by the US.  The surgeon then recommended an MRI as he said "I dont want to ask you to come back in 6  months incase there is cancer because then we would have lost 6 months of treatment".  Such a nice caring attitude.  I have a follow up appt on Thursday at 11h45.  From reading up on the internet that a dimple/indent and a lump combined are not good news however, if it is cancer I will fight it head on - it is not curable but at least it is treatable! Thanks for your kind thoughts! Sue
Posts.Title: MRI done today SueI12345 Betterwannabe

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2011 10:07AM SueI12345 wrote: nred2002, meme31 & debbie6122  Thank you for your kind responses.  I have done lots of reading on the internet and I dont know if I should be because some of the things can be downright scary!  I will post on Monday after the mamogram and let you know the results.  Thank you once again.   ((((hugs))))
Posts.Title: Indentation on Breast SueI12345 aldumont01

Posts.Content: SueI12345 wrote: The results came back B9!!  Huge relief.  Although I have to have another mammo and US in January 2012. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results Are In!! SueI12345 VSM

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 01:12AM SueI12345 wrote: Honey, so sorry you are going through this.  I suggest you find yourself a new Dr as your current one sounds so insensitive. I noticed a dimpling on my breast have had mammo done [normal] ultrasound done [normal] so went off to my gynae - she told me everything was normal.... but still the gut feel is that there is something not right.  Made an appt with a surgeon for a 2nd opinion, he did a manual checkup and found a huge area of thickening on one breast and a lump on the other.   I am booked in for an mri tomorrow - he just said that he is not going to send me away for 6 months only to find that we could have treated the problem now. You will probably have to shop around to find a sympathetic surgeon but honestly there is so much hype about breast cancer being on the increase - you would expect your dr to listen to you.  As no one knows their bodies better than you do.  Holding thumbs for you. Sue
Posts.Title: Dr made me feel I wasted her time. leeronnie barbe1958
